giantmetalbowserSound
Interface Playable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Sound
public interface Playable

The interface that playable sounds should implement. SoundListeners can be added to Playables to keep track of playback status.

Version:
1.0 September 31, 2010
Author:
Daniel Wong (giantmetalbowser)

Method Summary
 void addSoundListener(SoundListener soundListener)
          Adds a SoundListener to check for SoundEvents.
 boolean canBePlayed()
          Indicates whether the Playable can be played.
 java.lang.String getCanonicalPath()
          Returns the canonical path of the sound file to be played.

          Indicates whether the Playable is playing.
 boolean isRepeating()
          Indicates whether the Playable will repeat when played.
 void play()
          Plays this Playable from the beginning.
 void play(int startFrame)
          Plays this Playable from the given frame.
 void removeSoundListener(SoundListener soundListener)
          Removes the given SoundListener from this Playable.
 void setRepeating(boolean repeating)
          Sets whether the Playable will repeat when played.
 void stop()
          Stops this Playable if it is playing.

play

void play()
Plays this Playable from the beginning.

play

void play(int startFrame)
Plays this Playable from the given frame.

Parameters:
startFrame - The frame to start at.

stop

void stop()
Stops this Playable if it is playing.

isPlaying

boolean isPlaying()
Indicates whether the Playable is playing.

Returns:
true if the Playable is playing, false otherwise.

canBePlayed

boolean canBePlayed()
Indicates whether the Playable can be played.

Returns:
true if the Playable can be played, false otherwise.

isRepeating

boolean isRepeating()
Indicates whether the Playable will repeat when played.

Returns:
true if the Playable repeats when played, false otherwise.

setRepeating

void setRepeating(boolean repeating)
Sets whether the Playable will repeat when played.

Parameters:
repeating - if true, this Playable will repeat; otherwise, it will not repeat.

getCanonicalPath

java.lang.String getCanonicalPath()
Returns the canonical path of the sound file to be played.

Returns:
The canonical path of the sound file.

addSoundListener

void addSoundListener(SoundListener soundListener)
Adds a SoundListener to check for SoundEvents.

Parameters:
soundListener - The SoundListener to add.

removeSoundListener

void removeSoundListener(SoundListener soundListener)
Removes the given SoundListener from this Playable.

Parameters:
soundListener - The SoundListener to remove.
